definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: The all new collection from Blood Stream, with a 3D concertina background.
sentences.chinese: 新收集的所有從血液流，它具有三維手風琴的背景。

sentences.english: Shortly after, my lessons began with Mr. Zelli.
sentences.chinese: 不久，澤利先生開始教我拉手風琴。

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我別緻的手風琴好像變成了紙板盒。

sentences.english: My little sister began to learn the accordion four.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹四歲時開始學拉手風琴。

sentences.english: The accordion was in full blast in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 在大廳裏手風琴拉得非常響亮。

sentences.english: Further-more, Lucy can play the accordion (3) grace-fully and professionally.
sentences.chinese: 此外她還能拉出優美的手風琴曲，而且也很專業。

sentences.english: An accordion may have one panel open by default on initial display.
sentences.chinese: 手風琴導航默認可以有一個面板是展開的。

sentences.english: Borowski wears corduroy suits and plays the accordion.
sentences.chinese: 博羅夫斯基身着一套燈芯絨西裝，會拉手風琴。

sentences.english: In the last 25 years, however, the accordion bellows have expanded again.
sentences.chinese: 過去的25年裏，手風琴的風箱又擴展了。

sentences.english: The event kicks off with performances by a live accordion band .
sentences.chinese: 歡慶活動由一個手風琴樂團的現場演奏揭開序幕。

sentences.english: Mr. Wu can play the accordion very much.
Li Yundi the accordion the four.
sentences.chinese: 李雲迪在四歲時開始學手風琴。

sentences.english: Fishes blots out the sky and the land, dancing around Trapp and the accordion vehicle.
sentences.chinese: 鋪天蓋地的魚，從天上游下來，圍着手風琴。

sentences.english: He learned to play the accordion by practising in his spare time.
sentences.chinese: 他靠業餘時間練，來學拉手風琴。

sentences.english: Below the help of the foster father of spiccato accordion, she learned to read.
sentences.chinese: 在彈奏手風琴的養父的幫助下，她學會了閱讀。

definition: double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
ukulele/simplified form also written 尤克里里琴
